title._content: ["The Breakers,"  Cornelius Vanderbilt II house, 44 Ochre Point Avenue, Newport, Rhode Island. (LOC)

description._content: Johnston, Frances Benjamin,, 1864-1952,, photographer. ["The Breakers," Cornelius Vanderbilt II house, 44 Ochre Point Avenue, Newport, Rhode Island. View of terrace and loggia] [1914 summer] 1 photograph : glass lantern slide, hand-colored ; 3.25 x 4 in. Notes: Site History. House Architecture: Richard Morris Hunt, 1892-1896. Landscape: Ernest William Bowditch and James Higginson Bowditch. Associated Name: Alice Gwynne (Mrs. Cornelius) Vanderbilt II. Today: Public site of the Preservation Society of Newport County and a National Historic Landmark. On slide (handwritten): "V" and "Mrs. Vanderbilt." Photographed when Frances Benjamin Johnston and Mattie Edwards Hewitt worked together. Title, date, and subject information provided by Sam Watters, 2011. Forms part of: Garden and historic house lecture series in the Frances Benjamin Johnston Collection (Library of Congress). Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print Higher resolution image is available (Persistent URL): hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ppmsca.16768 Call Number: LC-J717-X108- 41
